gurmukhi: ਖਹੇ ਖੱਗ ਖੂਨੀ ਖੁਲੇ ਬੀਰ ਖੇਤੰ || ਨਚੇ ਕੰਧਿ ਹੀਣੰ ਕਮੱਧੰ ਨ੍ਰਿਚੇਤੰ ||੭||
transliteration: Khahe Khagg Khoonikhule Beer Khetan|| Nache Kandh(i) Heenan Kamaddhan Nrichetan||7||
translation: The bloody daggers of the warriors have come out in the battlefield and the headless trunks are dancing in an unconscious state.7.

gurmukhi: ਭਰੇ ਜੋਗਣੀ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਚੳੁਸਠ ਚਾਰੀ || ਨਚੀ ਖੋਲ ਸੀਸੰ ਬਕੀ ਬਿਕਰਾਰੀ ||
transliteration: Bhare Jogadipattra Chaousath Chdaree|| Nachidhol Seesan Bakibikrdaree||
translation: The sixty-four female evil spirit (Yoginis) have filled their bowls with blood;

gurmukhi: ਹਸੈ ਭੂਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਤੰ ਮਹਾ ਬਿਕਰਾਲੰ || ਬਜੇ ਡਾਕ ਡੳੁਰੂ ਕਰੂਰੰ ਕਰਾਲੰ ||੮||
transliteration: Hasai Bhoot Pretan Mahaa Bikraalan|| Bade Daak Dauroo Darooran Karaalan||8||
translation: And loosening their matted hair, they are raising their terrible sound, the most awful ghosts and fiends are laughing and the shrieking sound of the hideous vampires is being heard.8.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰਤ ਮੁਸਟੰ ਕਰੈ ਪਾਵ ਘਾਤੰ || ਮਨੋ ਸਿੰਘ ਸਿੰਘੰ ਡਹੇ ਗਜ ਮਾਤੰ ||
transliteration: Prahaarant Moustan Darai Paav Ghaatan|| Mano Singh Singhan Dahe Gad Maatan||
translation: The warriors are giving the blows of their fists and feet in this way as if the thundering lions have furiously attacked one another;

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੀ ੲੀਸ ਤਾੜੀ ਡਗਿਯੋ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਧਿਅਾਨੰ || ਭੱਜਯੋ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾ ਕਾਂਪ ਭਾਨੰ ਮਧਯਾਨੰ ||੯||
transliteration: Chhoutiees Taadidagiyo Brahm Dhiaanan|| Bhajjyo Channdramaa Kaanp Bhaanan Madhyaanan||9||
translation: Hearing the terrible sound of the war, the attention of gods Shiva and Brahma hath distracted; the moon also trembled and the noonday sun also fled in fear.9.

gurmukhi: ਜਲੇ ਬਾ ਥਲੇਥੰ ਥਲੰ ਤਥ ਨੀਰੰ || ਕਿਧੋ ਸੰਧਿਯੰ ਬਾਣ ਰਘੁ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਬੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Jale Baa Thaleyaan Thalan That Nderan|| Kidho Sandhiyan Baan Raghu Indra Bderan||
translation: There was water everywhere upward and downward and in this atmosphere Vishnu took aim of his arrows on his targets;

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ਦੈਤ ਅਾਘਾਤ ਮੁਸਟੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ || ਮਨੋ ਚੋਟ ਬਾਹੈ ਘਰਿਯਾਰੀ ਘਰਿਯਾਰੰ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Darai Dait Aaghaat Moustan Prahaaran|| Mano Chot Baahai Ghariyaarighariyaaran||
translation: The demons were collectively giving terrible blows of their fists in the way, like a crocodile aiming his blows on another crocodile.10.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਡੰਕ ਬੰਕੇ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੂਰੰ ਕਰਾਰੇ || ਮਨੋ ਗਜ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਦੰਤਾਰੇ ਦੰਤਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Bade Dank Banke Su Krooran Kardare|| Mano Gad Joutte Dantdare Dantdare||
translation: The trumpets resounded and the mighty and terrible warriors fought with each other in this way, as if the elephants with long tusks are fighting with each other.

gurmukhi: ਢਮੰਕਾਰ ਢੋਲੰ ਰਣੰਕੇ ਨਫੀਰੰ || ਸੜੱਕਾਰ ਸਾਂਗੰ ਤੜੱਕਾਰ ਤੀਰੰ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Dhamanndaar Dholan Rananke Naphderan|| Sadakkaar Saanadg Tadakkaar Tderan||11||
translation: The sound of the drums and horns was being heard and there was also the clattering of the daggers and the crackling of the arrows.11.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਨੰ ਅਸਟ ਜੁੱਧੰ ਭਯੋ ਅਸਟ ਰੈਣੰ || ਡਗੀ ਭੂਮ ਸਰਬੰ ੳੁਠਯੋ ਕਾਂਪ ਗੈਣੰ ||
transliteration: Dinan Ast Juddhan Bhayo Ast Rainan|| Dagibhoom Saraban Outhyo Kaanp Gadnan||
translation: The war was waged for eight days and eight nights, in which the earth and the sky trembled.
